Line 31: Line 31:
==Death==
==Death==
â
A number of protesters, including Isa Hassan, Ali's uncle, took part in a demonstration in [[Sitra]], [[Bahrain]] on 31 August just after [[Fajr|morning prayers]]. They stated that they were "confronted by the police, who fired tear gas at them from roughly 20 feet away" and causing Ali Jawad al-Sheikh's death. In an interview with the ''[[Associated Press]]'', Isa explained that "they are supposed to lob the canisters of gas, not shoot them at people. Police used it as a weapon."<ref name="NYT">{{cite news |title=A 14-Year-Old Boy Is Killed in Bahrain as Security Forces Break Up a Protest |author=J. David Goodman |url=http://www.nytimes.com/2011/09/01/world/middleeast/01bahrain.html?_r=2 |newspaper=[[New York Times]] |date=August 31, 2011 |accessdate=September 3, 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Shiite teenager killed in Bahrain demo: opposition |author= |url=http://www.google.com/hostednews/afp/article/ALeqM5hNosFeJn1CDW-5tkxxaV7gkw63sg?docId=CNG.ee159abe0e0b3f7c4e870162182b6233.3a1 |newspaper=[[Agence France-Presse]] |date=August 31, 2011 |accessdate=September 3, 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Bahraini boy killed in protest |author= |url=http://english.aljazeera.net/news/middleeast/2011/08/2011831132740548678.html?utm_content=automateplus&utm_campaign=Trial5&utm_source=SocialFlow&utm_term=tweets&utm_medium=MasterAccount |newspaper=[[Al Jazeera]] |date=August 31, 2011 |accessdate=September 3, 2011}}</ref>
+
[[File:Ali Jawad al-Sheikh dead.jpg|thumb|Ali Jawad al-Sheikh's corpse.]]
  +
A number of protesters, including Isa Hassan, Ali's uncle, took part in a demonstration in [[Sitra]], [[Bahrain]] on 31 August just after [[Fajr|morning prayers]]. They stated that they were "confronted by the police, who fired tear gas at them from roughly 20 feet away" and causing Ali Jawad al-Sheikh's death. In an interview with the ''[[Associated Press]]'', Isa explained that "they are supposed to lob the canisters of gas, not shoot them at people. Police used it as a weapon."<ref name="NYT">{{cite news |title=A 14-Year-Old Boy Is Killed in Bahrain as Security Forces Break Up a Protest |author=J. David Goodman |url=http://www.nytimes.com/2011/09/01/world/middleeast/01bahrain.html?_r=2 |newspaper=[[New York Times]] |date=August 31, 2011 |accessdate=September 3, 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Shiite teenager killed in Bahrain demo: opposition |author= |url=http://www.google.com/hostednews/afp/article/ALeqM5hNosFeJn1CDW-5tkxxaV7gkw63sg?docId=CNG.ee159abe0e0b3f7c4e870162182b6233.3a1 |newspaper=[[Agence France-Presse]] |date=August 31, 2011 |accessdate=September 3, 2011}}</ref><ref name="AJ">{{cite news |title=Bahraini boy killed in protest |author= |url=http://english.aljazeera.net/news/middleeast/2011/08/2011831132740548678.html?utm_content=automateplus&utm_campaign=Trial5&utm_source=SocialFlow&utm_term=tweets&utm_medium=MasterAccount |newspaper=[[Al Jazeera]] |date=August 31, 2011 |accessdate=September 3, 2011}}</ref>
After his death, Ali's body was removed from the hospital and moved to the morgue, where an [[autopsy]] was carried out.<ref name="CNN"/> In the afternoon, Osama al-Asfoor, the [[Director of Public Prosecutions|head of public prosecution]], stated that the autopsy had shown that "Ali had died of injuries to the back of his neck" and that "the boy had injuries under his chin and bruises on his face, hand, knees and pelvic area." However, he also added that a "blood examination showed no effects of tear gas exposure."<ref name="NYT"/>
After his death, Ali's body was removed from the hospital and moved to the morgue, where an [[autopsy]] was carried out.<ref name="CNN"/> In the afternoon, Osama al-Asfoor, the [[Director of Public Prosecutions|head of public prosecution]], stated that the autopsy had shown that "Ali had died of injuries to the back of his neck" and that "the boy had injuries under his chin and bruises on his face, hand, knees and pelvic area." However, he also added that a "blood examination showed no effects of tear gas exposure."<ref name="NYT"/>
==Aftermath==
==Aftermath==
â
[[File:Ali Jawad al-Sheikh dead.jpg|thumb|Ali Jawad al-Sheikh's corpse.]]
 
Photographs of Ali directly after being injured were released by the [[Human_rights_in_Bahrain#Human_Rights_Groups|Bahrain Youth Society for Human Rights]]. Mohammed al-Maskati, the leader of the Society, said that, "The picture is affecting people." A videotape had also been made of Ali's family around his body in the hospital. [[Nabeel Rajab]], the president of the [[Bahrain Center for Human Rights]], explained that the video was a "a gift to the people".<ref name="NYT"/> The father of Ali, Jawad al-Sheikh, asked in an interview with [[CNN]] for "human rights groups to take steps against Bahrain's leaders, saying, 'I lost my child. ... He does not deserve this destiny.'"<ref name="CNN">{{cite news |title=Police, protesters battle in Bahrain's streets after boy's death |author= |url=http://edition.cnn.com/2011/WORLD/meast/08/31/bahrain.death/ |newspaper=[[CNN]] |date=August 31, 2011 |accessdate=September 3, 2011}}</ref>
Photographs of Ali directly after being injured were released by the [[Human_rights_in_Bahrain#Human_Rights_Groups|Bahrain Youth Society for Human Rights]]. Mohammed al-Maskati, the leader of the Society, said that, "The picture is affecting people." A videotape had also been made of Ali's family around his body in the hospital. [[Nabeel Rajab]], the president of the [[Bahrain Center for Human Rights]], explained that the video was a "a gift to the people".<ref name="NYT"/> The father of Ali, Jawad al-Sheikh, asked in an interview with [[CNN]] for "human rights groups to take steps against Bahrain's leaders, saying, 'I lost my child. ... He does not deserve this destiny.'"<ref name="CNN">{{cite news |title=Police, protesters battle in Bahrain's streets after boy's death |author= |url=http://edition.cnn.com/2011/WORLD/meast/08/31/bahrain.death/ |newspaper=[[CNN]] |date=August 31, 2011 |accessdate=September 3, 2011}}</ref>
